    • Method Detail

      • createIdentity

        public static final Matrix createIdentity​(int size)
                                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates an identity matrix of the given size with name "I"+size (e.g., "I3" for a 3x3 identity matrix).
        Parameters:
        size - the size of the identity matrix (number of rows and columns)
        Returns:
        a new identity matrix of size size x size
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the matrix dimensions are invalid

      • createIdentity

        public static final Matrix createIdentity​(java.lang.String name,
                                          int size)
                                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates an identity matrix of the given size and name.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the matrix
        size - the size of the identity matrix (number of rows and columns)
        Returns:
        a new identity matrix of size size x size with the given name
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the matrix dimensions are invalid

      • createRandom

        public static Matrix createRandom​(java.lang.String name,
                                  int nRows,
                                  int nCols)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a random matrix of size nRows x nCols. Each element is filled with a random value between 0.0 (inclusive) and 1.0 (exclusive).
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the matrix
        nRows - the number of rows (must be strictly positive)
        nCols - the number of columns (must be strictly positive)
        Returns:
        a new nRows x nCols matrix filled with random values
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the matrix dimensions are invalid

      • getSubMatrix

        public Matrix getSubMatrix​(int offsetRow,
                           int offsetCol,
                           int numRows,
                           int numCols)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Extracts a submatrix of size numRows x numCols with top-left corner at position (offsetRow, offsetCol). This method does NOT modify the current matrix.
        Parameters:
        offsetRow - the starting row index (0-based)
        offsetCol - the starting column index (0-based)
        numRows - the number of rows to extract (must be at least 1)
        numCols - the number of columns to extract (must be at least 1)
        Returns:
        a new Matrix containing the extracted numRows x numCols submatrix
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the submatrix dimensions are invalid or extend beyond the matrix bounds

      • transpose

        public final Matrix transpose()
        Get the transposed matrix. This method does NOT modify the current matrix.
        Returns:
        a new Matrix that is the transpose of this matrix

      • multiply

        public final Matrix multiply​(Matrix m)
                      throws SizeMismatchException
        Matrix/Matrix multiplication. This method does NOT modify the current matrix or the operand.
        Parameters:
        m - the matrix to multiply with
        Returns:
        a new Matrix containing the result of this * m
        Throws:
        SizeMismatchException - if the matrix sizes do not match for multiplication

      • setCol

        public void setCol​(int i,
                   Vector v)
        Sets the i-th column in the matrix to the given vector. This method MODIFIES the current matrix.
        Parameters:
        i - the column index (0-based)
        v - the vector to set (its size must match the number of rows)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the vector size does not match the number of rows or if the column index is invalid

      • getCol

        public final Vector getCol​(int i)
        Get the elements of the i-th column of the matrix as a vector. This method does NOT modify the current matrix.
        Parameters:
        i - the column index
        Returns:
        a new Vector containing the elements of column i
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the column index is invalid

      • setRow

        public void setRow​(int i,
                   Vector v)
        Sets the i-th row in the matrix to the given vector. This method MODIFIES the current matrix.
        Parameters:
        i - the row index (0-based)
        v - the vector to set (its size must match the number of columns)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the vector size does not match the number of columns or if the row index is invalid

        i - the row index
        Returns:
        a new Vector containing the elements of row i

        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the row index is invalid
